page.title: 03A FARMER'S DAY
page.content: Mr Stevens, the farmer at Standish Court Farm, has to get up each day at 5 o'clock. He has three and a half helpers on the farm. First he has to get the Friesian cows milked and then he moves the fences so that the cattle can get fresh grass for the day. Then he has breakfast. After breakfast, Mr Stevens and his son, Graham, make the round silage bales and feed all the other animals. He has an hour for dinner, then they put plastic bags on the hay bales to protect them from the rain. About 1000 hay bales are needed on this farm for the cows to eat in winter. In the evening, the cows are milked again. He stops work at about 8.15 pm. His busy day is over.
